question_stem.en: A 55-year-old man with HIV comes to the emergency department due to 3 weeks of increasing headache, fever, and vomiting. Examination shows low blood pressure and neck stiffness. The patient's condition quickly deteriorates, and he dies in the hospital despite appropriate treatment. Autopsy of the brain shows a diffuse gelatinous exudate covering the base of the brain. Cut sections of the brain show marked ventriculomegaly and frontal lobe infarcts but no intraparenchymal mass lesions.
question_stem.zh: 一名患有 HIV 的 55 岁男性因 3 周来加重的头痛、发烧和呕吐来到急诊科。检查显示低血压和颈部僵硬。尽管给予了适当的治疗，但患者的病情迅速恶化，并在医院死亡。脑部尸检显示弥漫性胶状渗出物覆盖大脑底部。脑切片显示明显的脑室扩大和额叶梗死，但无脑实质内占位性病变。

question.en: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
question.zh: 以下哪项是最可能的诊断？

C.zh: 原发性中枢神经系统淋巴瘤

explanation.en:
This patient's subacute symptoms and autopsy findings are highly suggestive of tuberculous (TB) meningitis, the most common central nervous system (CNS) manifestation of disseminated TB. TB meningitis arises when circulating bacilli lodge in the subependymal or subpial space, forming a tubercle that subsequently ruptures into the subarachnoid space. Common findings include the following:

• A thick, gelatinous exudate most prominent in the basal portion of the brain. This exudate can encase the cranial nerves, leading to cranial nerve palsy, and invade the circle of Willis, leading to stroke.
• Tuberculous vasculitis of the cerebral arteries. This can cause multiple bilateral brain infarctions, particularly in the periventricular cerebral areas.
• Hydrocephalus due to obstruction of cerebrospinal fluid outflow by tuberculous proteins. This can cause elevated intracranial pressure (eg, headache, nausea, vomiting) and ventriculomegaly.

Although CNS invasion occurs in only ~5% of extrapulmonary TB, risk is increased in those with significant immunocompromise due to HIV, immunosuppressive medications, advanced age, or malnutrition.

(Choice A) Herpes simplex virus type 1 can spread via the trigeminal nerve (CN V) to the brain. Patients usually develop rapid-onset (not subacute) fever, headache, seizure, altered mental status, and neurologic deficits. Autopsy typically shows unilateral temporal lobe inflammation, not hydrocephalus or a gelatinous exudate in the basal brain.

(Choice B) Neurocysticercosis is caused by the larval stage of the pork tapeworm Taenia solium. It is generally marked by intraparenchymal cysts at several stages of development. The lack of intraparenchymal lesions makes neurocysticercosis unlikely. In addition, patients generally present with seizures or focal neurologic deficits.

(Choice C) Primary CNS lymphoma is more common in patients with HIV but is usually marked by a single large mass in the parenchyma of the brain. The presence of a thick, gelatinous exudate and no intraparenchymal brain lesions would not be typical.

(Choice D) Toxoplasma encephalitis is common in patients with advanced HIV who are not on prophylaxis. Although it often presents with slowly progressive headache, vomiting, and/or fever, it is marked by multiple intraparenchymal lesions in the brain.

Educational objective:
Tuberculous (TB) meningitis is characterized by formation of a thick, gelatinous exudate in the base of the brain, cerebral vasculitis, and hydrocephalus. It frequently presents with subacute, slowly progressive nausea, vomiting, fever, cranial nerve deficits, and strokes.
explanation.zh:
该患者的亚急性症状和尸检结果高度提示结核性（TB）脑膜炎，这是播散性结核病最常见的中枢神经系统 (CNS) 表现。结核性脑膜炎的发生是由于循环中的杆菌进入室管膜下或软脑膜下间隙，形成结核结节，随后破裂进入蛛网膜下腔。常见发现包括：

• 脑底部的厚而胶状的渗出物最为突出。这种渗出物可以包绕脑神经，导致脑神经麻痹，并侵入 Willis 环，导致中风。
• 脑动脉的结核性血管炎。这可导致多发性双侧脑梗死，尤其是在脑室周围区域。
• 由于结核蛋白阻塞脑脊液流出引起的脑积水。这可导致颅内压升高（如头痛、恶心、呕吐）和脑室扩大。

尽管中枢神经系统浸润仅发生在约 5% 的肺外结核病中，但在因 HIV、免疫抑制药物、高龄或营养不良而出现严重免疫功能低下的患者中，风险会增加。

（选项 A）单纯疱疹病毒 1 型可以通过三叉神经 (CN V) 扩散到大脑。患者通常会发生快速发作（非亚急性）的发烧、头痛、癫痫发作、精神状态改变和神经功能障碍。尸检通常显示单侧颞叶炎症，而非脑底部的脑积水或胶状渗出物。

（选项 B）神经囊虫病是由猪肉绦虫 Taenia solium 的幼虫引起的。它通常以处于不同发育阶段的脑实质内囊肿为特征。缺乏脑实质内病变使得神经囊虫病不太可能。此外，患者通常表现为癫痫发作或局灶性神经功能障碍。

（选项 C）原发性中枢神经系统淋巴瘤在 HIV 感染患者中更常见，但通常以大脑实质中的单个大肿块为特征。存在厚而胶状的渗出物，且无脑实质内脑病变，这并不典型。

（选项 D）弓形虫脑炎在未接受预防性治疗的晚期 HIV 感染患者中很常见。虽然它通常表现为缓慢进展的头痛、呕吐和/或发烧，但其特征是大脑中多发性脑实质内病变。

教育目标：
结核性（TB）脑膜炎的特征是在脑底部形成厚而胶状的渗出物，伴有脑血管炎和脑积水。它经常表现为亚急性、缓慢进展的恶心、呕吐、发烧、脑神经功能障碍和中风。

summary.en:
This question tests the understanding of the clinical presentation and autopsy findings of tuberculous meningitis in an immunocompromised patient. It requires differentiating TB meningitis from other common CNS infections in HIV patients based on characteristic pathological features.

To solve this question, one must correlate the subacute onset of symptoms (headache, fever, vomiting, neck stiffness) with the autopsy findings (diffuse gelatinous exudate at the base of the brain, ventriculomegaly, frontal lobe infarcts, and absence of intraparenchymal masses) and consider the patient's immunocompromised status (HIV). This pattern strongly points towards TB meningitis.
summary.zh:
此题考察了对免疫功能低下患者结核性脑膜炎的临床表现和尸检结果的理解。它需要根据特征性的病理特征将结核性脑膜炎与其他 HIV 感染患者常见的 CNS 感染区分开来。

要解决这个问题，必须将亚急性症状（头痛、发烧、呕吐、颈部僵硬）的出现与尸检结果（大脑底部弥漫性胶状渗出物、脑室扩大、额叶梗死，以及无脑实质内肿块）相关联，并考虑患者的免疫功能低下状态（HIV）。这种模式强烈指向结核性脑膜炎。
